I stood outside Akane's room, psyching myself up\nto invite her to the concert.%K%P
'Okay, here we go...'%K%P
I took a deep breath, and knocked.%K%P
'Who is it?'%K%P
'It's me. Do you have a minute?'%K%P
'Sho? Hold on.'%K%P
'You don't drop by my room too often. What's\nup?'%K%P
'Are you free tomorrow?'%K%P
'I don't have plans... Besides lounging around\nmy room, that is.'%K%P
'Do you want to go somewhere with me, then?'%K%P
'Huh? That's pretty sudden...'%K%P
I decided to press on before Akane had a chance\nto suspect I had some kind of ulterior motive.%K%P
'Take a look at this.'%K%P
I handed her the flyer.%K%P
'Oh? This is that thing I was looking at\nbefore...'%K%P
'I was just thinking, you haven't been outside\nin a while. Go to the concert, get some fresh\nair, it could be fun, right?'%K%P
Akane stared blankly at the flyer.%K%P
'You don't want to?'%K%P
'You know I said I quit...'%K%P
'Don't read into it too much. It's a festival,\nthere's all kinds of fun stuff we could do\nthere.'%K%P
'Plus... I'd be a little embarrassed to go see\nthat kind of concert myself. I'd be a lot more\ncomfortable if I had some company.'%K%P
'Heheh, seriously?'%K%P
Akane hesitated for a minute, then nodded and\nlooked me straight in the eye.%K%P
'Okay, fine... I'll go with you.'%K%P
'Awesome. Thanks, Akane!'%K%P
'Heh, no problem. See you tomorrow.'%K%P
The door closed behind her, and I heaved a sigh\nof relief.%K%P
At least now we knew Akane would be at the\nconcert.%K%P
'The rest is up to me...'%K%P
Tomorrow was going to be a big day.%K%P
The next day, I was all ready to ask Akane some\nserious questions.%K%P
With a plan all ready in my mind, the two of us\nmade our way to Kannagi's only public park.%K%P
'Wow, there's so many people here!'%K%P
'Events like this are about the only time you\nsee the park so full.'%K%P
Most days it was home to only a few joggers, or\nold people walking their dogs. Today though, the\nentire park was jam packed with people.%K%P
The area around the stage was especially lively.%K%P
'So this is a concert crowd, huh?'%K%P
'It's my first time seeing something live, too.\nIt's totally different from seeing it on TV,\nhuh?'%K%P
'Yeah...totally.'%K%P
Akane's eyes darted around as if to take in\neverything all at once.%K%P
I had a feeling the bustling festival atmosphere\nwould appeal to her.%K%P
'There's still time before it starts, wanna look\naround?'%K%P
'Sure! C'mon Sho, let's take a look over there!'%K%P
'Okay, I'm coming! Slow down.'%K%P
'This is sooo cool!'%K%P
'Right? Even local idols are really something.'%K%P
We sat on a bench watching the crowds go by and\neating fries we bought at one of the food\nstands.%K%P
'There's so many places selling food around\nhere, but that one is really top-notch!'%K%P
'And it's got a Divine Idol tending shop. That's\npretty hard to beat!'%K%P
I looked back at the long line of people we'd\njust left behind. It still showed no signs of\nslowing.%K%P
One of the idols was making an early appearance\nhelping out at the food stalls as part of some\nkind of publicity stunt.%K%P
'She's generating buzz even before the show\nstarts. I'm impressed.'%K%P
'I always thought idols just sang and danced,\nbut really they do so much more.'%K%P
Akane reached for a fry. Her hand was trembling\nslightly.%K%P
'*Munch munch* I'm kinda stunned... I feel like\nI underestimated them.'%K%P
'Idols, you mean?'%K%P
'Yeah... Look at her keeping up conversations\nwith crowds of people, and all with a smile.'%K%P
Akane's eyes were still fixed on the stall and\nits long line.%K%P
We could see the idol from our spot. She was\nsmiling, taking orders, shaking hands. Her face\ndidn't show the slightest sign of stress.%K%P
'I couldn't do that. I could try and try with\neverything I've got, but I'd never manage.'%K%P
'Well, that's okay, isn't it?'%K%P
Seeing Akane start to get downhearted, I found\nmyself giving her some words of encouragement.%K%P
'You are who you are. You're not her.'%K%P
'You don't need to try to be someone else.\nYou're at your best when you're just being\nyourself.'%K%P
'You really think so?'%K%P
'Yeah. Just take your time, do things at your\nown pace. Live for yourself.'%K%P
'My own pace, huh...'%K%P
I still wanted to help reform Akane.%K%P
But not if it meant lumping all this stress on\nher and making her live up to unrealistic\nexpectations.%K%P
As Akane chewed over my words, I did my best to\nbe patient, and let her come up with a reply in\nher own time.%K%P
'Sho, I--'%K%P
'Thank you all for coming today.'%K%P
'The Divine Idol concert will begin shortly at\nthe central stage.'%K%P
An announcement blared out from the speakers\nplaced all around the park.%K%P
It was finally time for the concert.%K%P
'Did you say something, Akane?'%K%P
'Oh, uh, nothing! C'mon, let's grab a seat\nbefore they're all gone!'%K%P
'Okay, sure. We better hurry.'%K%P
The announcement drowned out whatever she was\nabout to say, so I just followed her to the\nstage.%K%P
Most of the seats were already full by the time\nwe got there.%K%P
'Aw, man. If only we came a little earlier...'%K%P
The people that were already here were no doubt\nfans of the idols performing.%K%P
They already had flags, banners, and glow sticks\nprimed and ready to start cheering.%K%P
'Let's find a place and-- Sho, look! Quick, over\nthere!'%K%P
'Okay, I'm coming!'%K%P
Akane pretty much dragged me to the spot she\nfound.%K%P
They weren't exactly the best seats in the\nhouse, but we could see the stage just fine.%K%P
'Wow, we lucked out. I wouldn't want to stand\nthe whole time in the middle of a crowd like\nthis.'%K%P
'Heheh. Not bad, right?'%K%P
'Yeah, you did good.'%K%P
'My eyesight can't be beat! I still can't\nbelieve there's so many people crammed in\nhere...'%K%P
'Everyone's so pumped, and the show hasn't even\nstarted yet.'%K%P
The venue was packed with spectators as far as\nthe eye could see. Finding two empty seats in\nthe middle of this crowd wasn't easy.%K%P
'Idols have so many people willing to support\nthem. Being here in person really brings it\nhome.'%K%P
'Jealous?'%K%P
'Hm, I dunno... I guess it would be cool to have\nlots of fans like this.'%K%P
'Really, now?'%K%P
Before long, all the chatter and cheering made\nmore conversation impossible.%K%P
'Oh, it's starting! Isn't that the girl from\nbefore?'%K%P
The idol we'd seen helping at the food stall\nearlier had walked out onto the stage.%K%P
She greeted her fans with a smile, took a deep\nbreath, and grasped the mic.%K%P
'Hellooo, Kannagi! Everyone, thank you so much\nfor coming out today!'%K%P
'Yaaaaay!'%K%P
'We're all gonna do our best to put on a great\nshow! Are you ready?!'%K%P
'Yeeeeeeah!!!'%K%P
'Here we go!'%K%P
Right on cue, a number of other idols appeared\non stage. I guess they were all part of the same\ngroup.%K%P
They took up their positions and launched into\ntheir opening number.%K%P
Their upbeat songs, flawless dancing and\ndazzling smiles had the audience enthralled.%K%P
Experiencing it first-hand was so much more\nintense than watching a video, and soon enough\nthe idols' smiles had infected the audience too.%K%P
They danced and cheered, bringing the park's\natmosphere to fever pitch.%K%P
'Wow, this is what a live concert's like...'%K%P
Akane stared at the stage and the performers\nwith a hint of jealousy in her eyes.%K%P
I could feel her excitement, envy, and\nadmiration from where I was sitting.%K%P
'They've got a real strong stage presence, huh?'%K%P
'Yeah... They're so much more wonderful than I\ncould have imagined! And look at all the fans!'%K%P
'The fans? Oh right... I don't think I can keep\nup with them.'%K%P
Whole groups of spectators were energetically\nwaving glow sticks and personalized fans in time\nwith the music.%K%P
It was easy to tell just how passionate they\nwere about enjoying and supporting the show.%K%P
'The songs, the dancing, the fans... They all\ncome together to make this happen...'%K%P
Without realizing it, Akane had also started to\nsway along with the rhythm.%K%P
It was like she was trying to experience it with\nevery fiber of her being.%K%P
The first song ended and the idols waved out at\nthe audience, their faces beaming.%K%P
Not to be outdone, Akane waved back with all her\nmight.%K%P
'I would love to do that. Sing and dance\nonstage, drink in all that applause...'%K%P
'It must feel good getting cheered on by so many\npeople.'%K%P
'Right?! I bet there's nothing like it!'%K%P
Akane met my eye for a moment, full of joy, then\nit seemed like something else crossed her mind.%K%P
'But...I know it's never going to happen. I'm an\nAragami, I couldn't do what these girls do.'%K%P
'It's better that I don't embarrass myself\ntrying.'%K%P
'Is that what you were going to tell me before?'%K%P
'Yeah... I'm not like other goddesses, I\nwouldn't stand a chance.'%K%P
'I agree that you're different, but that isn't\nnecessarily a bad thing.'%K%P
'Really?'%K%P
'Really. I still think you'd make a great idol,\nAkane.'%K%P
'And I'm not just trying to butter you up. The\ntime we've spent together has shown me how\ndetermined you can be.'%K%P
'You learned how to stop causing blackouts so\noften, right? All that work you put into trying\nto become an idol wasn't in vain.'%K%P
'But I...'%K%P
'I'm not saying you have to get back into it. I\nknow you've got a lot going on right now.'%K%P
'Whatever you decide, I promise I'll accept it.\nBut I do want you to know that you've already\ngot one fan, and that's me.'%K%P
'You're my fan?'%K%P
'That's right. I've watched you practice every\nday, it's not so hard to believe, is it?'%K%P
Seeing Akane striving toward her goal had always\ninspired me.%K%P
That was something only she could do.%K%P
'I actually have a fan...?'%K%P
'This feels kinda weird. Like, I could do\nsomething not for me, but to make someone else\nhappy...'%K%P
Akane's expression seemed lighter. As the next\nsong started up, her gaze settled on a spot\nsomewhere about the stage.%K%P
The Divine Idols were once more met with wild\ncheers from their fans.%K%P
She hungrily took in the whole scene.%K%P
I started to get the feeling that the day I'd\nsee Akane on stage might not be so far away\nafter all.%K%P
